definition: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe (1749-1832), German poet and dramatist
to sing the praises of sb
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]

sentences.english: All Grado headphones have a vented diaphragm design that incorporates a large air chamber.
sentences.chinese: 所有歌德耳機有一個發泄隔膜設計，採用了大型氣室。

sentences.english: I have been told that Goethe said that architecture is frozen music.
sentences.chinese: 俺一直聽人家說，歌德講，建築是凝固的音樂。

sentences.english: Schiller, Goethe only in the face, only feel the need to escape out.
sentences.chinese: 席勒，也只有在歌德面前，才覺得有必要脫身而出。

sentences.english: With 16 "Mignon Songs" in " Goethe Poem Songs Showcase" as Example.
sentences.chinese: 以《歌德名詩歌曲精選》中16首“迷娘曲”爲例。

sentences.english: Grado utilizes a special processing method to increase the material's porosity.
sentences.chinese: 歌德採用了特殊的處理方法來提高材料的孔隙度。

sentences.english: Goethe's language is more beautiful than all the ornaments of the shepherds of the Pegnitz.
sentences.chinese: 歌德的語言比派尼茲牧羊人的全部裝飾都精緻。

sentences.english: J. W. Goethe, 1817, Principles of Natural Science.
This building architecture is a hybrid of gothic and modern style.
sentences.chinese: 這個建築物混合了歌德式和現代式的兩種建築風格。

sentences.english: As Goethe says "the theories is gray, the tree of life is evergreen."
sentences.chinese: 正如歌德所言“理論是灰色的，生命之樹常青。”

sentences.english: The Goethe-Institut offers scholarships to students from foreign countries.
sentences.chinese: 歌德學院提供獎學金的學生來自外國。

sentences.english: Schubert set some of Goethe's lyrics to music.
sentences.chinese: 舒伯特把歌德的一些抒情詩譜成了歌曲。

definition: Honoré de Balzac (1799-1850), French novelist, author of series La comédie humaine
